1.content:
It is a typical day in the small medieval village of Norlec.The peasants are out, trotting between bartering stands, hunting for their nightly meal. The nobles and merchants, on the other hand, are locked squarely away in their manors and shops, content to enjoy the warm summer day in their interior shade. It is in this second group that you, a gastromancer's apprentice, find yourself. Your mistress, a one Madame Lustria, is the owner of a small alchemy shop. It is there that you spent most of your young life, slaving away behind the counter, refining all sorts of spells and potions on your journey to become a full fledged magic user.

Today, it seems, is no different. Madame Lustria has departed for the morning and had left you alone to finish a customers order. It is nothing special; just your run-of-the-mill aphrodisiac. A hint of faerie's wing here, a splash of minotaur semen there and you were sure to have a decently potent product. You had made this potion many times before and, to be honest, you were getting tired of it. The days of your inexperienced youth had passed and you are eager to move on to bigger and better challenges.

As you stand at the counter, imbuing the potion with the last of the necessary magical essence, the sound of the rickety old door creaking open catches your attention. Turning back, you are greeted with the image of a thicker woman. She is sporting a large set of breasts and a fine layer of blubber throughout her body. The black haired beaut is sporting an excited grin; a grin you recognize.

"Hello, my dear apprentice," Madame Lustria says, "How goes the potion?"

"Almost finished, Madame. The potion should be ready long before the client arrives."

"Excellent work, dear!" she continues as she presses herself against the counter. "Oh, and I got some very good news for you, dear..."

You swallow nervously. Though you respect your mentor, her idea of "good news" often clashed with your own. Sucking up your pride, you inquire further.

"What's the news?"

"I have a quest for you to embark on. No more making potions for you!"

Your body jerks so hard out of shock that you nearly dropped the potion.

"Are you serious, what is it?!"

"Now, now, calm down. It's not too amazing, but it should be something you can handle. After all, you are an adult now, though just barely. Why, I remember when you were just a little..."
1.title: A Not-So-Normal Day

11.content:
"Why, I remember when you were just a little girl, not a day past eight."

You roll your eyes. Madame Lustria was the overly nostalgic type. Not a day would pass without her reminiscing about the way things used to be. Sometimes you couldn't help but wonder if perhaps she was dissatisfied with how you had turned out. Though socially you two are close, your physical appearances were about as far from each other as they possibly could be. Lustria was curvier, sporting grapefruit sized bosom, wide buttocks, and a slight pot-belly that drove the men at the tavern wild.

You, in comparison, are a twig. Your breasts are nearly non-existent, looking more like mosquito bites than lumps of flesh. The bumper matched the headlights, so-to-speak, leaving you with an equally flat buttocks. Of your features, the only ones of any note are your feminine hips. Lustria had been feeding you for years in preparation for your eventual transition into gastromancy, but as it would seem, your body simply had not yet taken hold. It was for that reason, you figure, that Madame Lustria had held you back.

"Alright, enough reminiscing," you dismiss, "What exactly is this quest?"

"There's a nearby cave that the peasants claim has been swallowing people up. Complete bull, really, but you know how the uneducated get. The mayor's gotten worked up, though, and he hired us to go check it out."

"Us?"

"Well, you, since I'm letting you handle this on your own. I wouldn't worry too much, though. It's probably nothing."

"Yeah," you conceded, brushing your red hair from your eyes, "Though it will be nice to get some practice. When do I have to be off?"

"Now!"

Before you can even react, she wrapps her pudgy finger around your thin twig of an arm and drags you to the door. Knowing better than to resist, you let her shove you out. The rickety door slams shut behind you.Armed only with your robe and gastro magic, you make your way out of the town and into the nearby forest. The town guard were kind enough to point out the general area the "killer cave" was supposedly located in and you find it in no time.

As you approach, your keen eyes notice something amiss. Examining the surrounding further, you discover the tell-tale signs of...
11.title: Girl Power

choices: You go for the pixie, but mess it up
111.content:
To you, the signs are clear. Discarded flagons of ale, still moist with recently drunken alcohol. Piles of trash and other debris sat beside them, lazily strew about beside the cave entrance. Trees nearby were etched with the scars of sword scratches. There was no mistaking it; these were bandits. Fearsome ones, too, if the peasants were to be believed. Even with your powerful gastromancy, you can't help but feel a lingering sense of fear. You had never entered actual combat before, much less against a group of experienced fighters.

Nevertheless, you steel your resolve and silently slip into the cave. Lustria would never let you live it down if you returned to her for help. In addition, she would most likely delay your training ever further than she had already had. Turning back is not an option.

As you make your way through the dark, damp hole, you began to notice more and more signs of life. More trash, more debris, and to your shock, blood. You become a bit more shaken, realizing that if you're not careful that could very well be your own sanguine stain. Before you can examine further, however, your alert ears catch the sound of jovial laughter not far from your position. Continuing on, you eventually reach a larger part of the cavern. Inside, you see about three bandits, huddled around a fire. They are large brutes, composed of two humans and an orc.

Caught up in their own discussion, none of them notice as you slip into the room and take shelter behind a towering pile of crates. Now safe for the moment, you begin to formulate a plan on how to deal with the murderous scum. Had you been the masterful Lustria, it would have been simple; You would start by jumping out and casting a daze spell on the group, freezing them just long enough to send the orc down your gullet. Then, just as it wore off and the other two began to charge, you would hit one of them with a shrink spell and counter the remaining one. He would be taken off guard, too surprised to act as you easily swallowed him as well. Your bloated belly now stuffed to the brim, you would casually approach the inch-tall remainder and decided his fate. In the end, he would either wind up smashed beneath your heel or receive a one way trip up your backside.

Of course, you are not Lustria. You do not posses the skills to take all three on at once. You are going to have to be crafty to take care of these worms. It is then that you notice something promising. Across the room, sitting beside the orc was a glass jar. Inside this jar sat a small pixie. Pixies, the little beings of magic they are, are a coveted race. For most, they are captured due to their reputation as horny little things, willing to suck off any race for freedom. To a gastromancer like you, though, they area a quick power boost. Swallow (or chew) one down and their magical energies would temporarily become yours, boosting your base skill level.

It was tempting, but again, it sits right beside the orc. Do you risk using a levitate spell to bring it towards you or did you instead try to take them out one by one?
111.title: Inside the Bandit Camp

1111.content:
The power of the pixie is too much to ignore. The boost will be more than enough to change the coming battle and you are willing to risk stealing the damn thing if it means you will be less likely to end up as some orc's sex slave.

Peeking out around the box, you place your right arm forward, aiming it directly at the pixie jar. You wait for a perfect opportunity; for a moment where the group would be truly distracted. It takes a while but your patience eventually pays off. The orc, speaking in a language you don't understand, suddenly shoots up and begins yelling at the top of his lungs. For a moment, you are worried they had noticed you. Relief washes over you as the orc approaches his compatriots and draws his sword, perhaps offended by something his friend said. Not one to waste an opportunity, you cast your levitate spell. At the moment, your weak powers only let you levitate up to ten pounds. More than enough for the current task.

The three brutes fail to notice as the insignificant jar floats away. It slowly makes its way across the room, ducking behind an indiscriminate pile of crates. You confidently snatch the jar from the air as it pulls up to your position. Pride overflows from within you, forcing you to stifle a cheerful giggle. With nary a clue left of your trick, you have successfully accomplished your goal.

As you began to unscrew the lid to the jar, you are faced with another question: how to devour the pixie? As a gastromancer, all that is required is that you devour it. Any method is acceptable. As you see it, your options are to send the pixie down your gullet, up your backside or unbirth it.

What do you do?
1111.title: Pixie Power

11111.content:
You feel a rumble in your stomach as you stare at the helpless pixie trapped in her jar. Because of your situation earlier, you had never had the opportunity to indulge in some breakfast. It has been well over twelve hours since you have last eaten and you are positively starving. Tempting as the sexual pleasure from anally voring or unbirthing the pixie may be, these base lusts are unable to surpass your primal hunger. You have become set on orally devouring the thing.

Before you actually eat her, though, you decide to get a closer look at your next meal. Drawing the jar to your face, you examine the being inside the glass cage. She's a pretty little thing, blessed with a curvaceous figure and beautiful violet locks. Like most pixies, she's around six inches in height; small enough for you to swallow effortlessly. If you even want to swallow her, that is. Chewing the girl up with your pearly incisors is a method as well. One that tickles your dominant desires particularly well.

The pixie, glad to be free of her sexual masters, locks her shimmering blue eyes with yours. She has a look of gleeful hope, one that would surely disappear if she knew of your gastromancery. Eager to feast, you begin to unscrew the jar, raising a finger to your lips to let the pixie know to remain quiet. She returns an affirmative nod.

After a small struggle (that orc screwed the lid tight!) the lid comes off with a pop. You reach in a grab the pixie with your dextrous fingers. The pixie, believing you to be a friend, remains docile even as you slowly inch her towards your hungry maw.

Before you can act, though, you have one more decision to make. Swallow her whole or chew her up?
11111.title: Pixie Prepartation

choices: Use your beefed up powers to shrink them
Wait for the opportunity to swallow one whole
111111.content:
In the end, you choose to keep it simple and swallow the pixie whole. As fun as it iss to chew your meals, you decide that the pleasure of having the pixie writhe in your stomach is more fulfilling. With nothing holding you back, you devour her in earnest, slamming your clenched fist into your mouth before the pixie even knows what hit her. Her entire form slides into your mouth, kicking and punching at your tongue and teeth in a futile effort to stop the inevitable.

These efforts, of course, result in little. She quickly passes through your mouth, soon finding herself at the top of your throat. Again, she gropes around, hoping to catch herself on your uvula. For a moment, one of her hands actually manages to grab it, though the warm saliva coating it causes her to slip and continue her descent. From there, there is little the pixie can do other than accept her slide down your esophagus.

A few seconds later and the pixie finally passes through the stomach valve, landing in the awful-smelling chamber with a sickening splash. All five of her senses are assaulted. Her vision is blinded by overwhelming darkness. The smell, as mentioned, is entirely awful. The taste, as her face had come into contact with the acid, ss a conglomeration of whatever meal you had eaten last. The sound is that of your stomach rhythmically churning in a foreboding manner. The touch, most importantly, is the all-important tingle of acid that will soon be breaking the helpless pixie down into nutrients.

You, in comparison, are feeling great. Your stomach has been filled, satisfying the painful hunger you had felt. Better still, you can feel the tingle of magic amplifying within your stomach. Though the acids have not yet begun their work on the pixie, your stomach is blessed with magical absorption, allowing you to immediately absorb the magic of those trapped in your stomach. Because of that, you have to act quickly to utilize the overflow of magic before the pixie passes away. Once she was dead, the magic will fade.

You rubbed your flat stomach proudly as you consider how to deal with the three bandits. You now have the power, thanks to the pixie, but you still need a plan. What do you do?
111111.title: Down the Hatch

choices: It works! The spell holds up just long enough.
It fails! You're spell wasn't as powerful as you hoped.
112.content:
... Cat girls.

The most obvious sign is the small piles of fur scattered throughout the area, another is the scratches against the trees, indicating that something had been using them as a scratching post. As you get closer to the cave, you start to slow down, doing your best to remain hidden. You carefully sneak into the entrance and slowly follow the walls of the cave. After a minute of sneaking, you freeze as you hear a purr from deeper in the cave. You quickly move to a small outcropping in the cave wall, before craning your neck around the corner. Further down in the cave, as the cave opens up, you see five catgirls sleeping together on a large bedding of straw. Most of them look fairly small, probably only being kittens. In the middle of the group though, is a much larger cat girl with a large, squirming gut.

"That must be the reason for the killer cave," you think to yourself, "That cat girl must be eating the townsfolk to feed her kittens."

You hate to think about taking out a family of cat girls, but you can't just leave them alone and let them eat the town. Suddenly, you hear a noise from the pile, so you press yourself deeper into your hiding place. After a moment, you peek around the corner to see the largest cat girl standing up, their large stomach swaying side to side. You see her stretch her limbs before she lets her hands rest on her belly. You see her begin to sniff in the air, and after a moment, she turns towards you. You dip back into your hiding spot as you hear her footsteps getting closer.

"Did a little mousey wander into my house while I was sleeping?" The cat girl said in a taunting voice, "I sure hope so, 'cause mama needs all the food she can get for her little kitties."

Your breathing starts to become erratic as you hear her get closer. You try to steady yourself, placing your hands against the cool cave wall. After a moment, you ready yourself for when she walks around the corner, preparing a paralyzation spell. The first thing you spot is her bloated stomach, which peaks around the corner for a moment before she follows. As she turns to face you, you see her licking her lips in anticipation, but you quickly shoot off your spell with it hitting her dead center in her belly.

The cat girl freeze's in place, the spell stopping her movements completely. You jump at her, hoping you can pin her down and swallow her before the spell wears off.
112.title: Cat Girls

choices: Swallow them down too, it's best for them to remain with their mother.
Adopt them, it's common enough to keep cat girls as pets.
1121.content:
Tackling the cat girl, you both tumble to the ground. With the cat girl now flat on her back, you get up on your hands and knees before crawling over to her head, positioning yourself behind her. Taking a deep breath to calm your nerves, you take the plunge, opening your mouth wide and slipping the girl's head between your lips. You hold onto her stiff shoulders as you take your first swallow, her head entering your throat. Your lips stretch wide as her shoulders begin to enter your mouth. They're quickly followed by the cat girl's breasts, and you pause at the crest of your biggest challenge yet. You look upon the large, squirming gut in front of you and are unsure if you'll even be able to get it down but feeling a twinge of movement inside you, you push forward along the mountainous gut. At first, the process is easy, you're easily able to open your mouth wide enough to slide over the first couple inches of her belly but as you continue on, you begin to reach your limit. You feel a small amount of pain from the corners of your mouth as your lips strain to stretch over the cat girl's stomach. Using your hands to squish her belly, you finally manage to get it into your mouth with a satisfying *pop*. You take a moment to breathe a sigh of relief, the hardest part now over, but as you look forward at the rest of the cat girl, you do see something that'll give you a bit of trouble. You see that the cat girl's legs are starting to move, meaning that your spell had run out. You quickly get to work on getting the rest of her down before she causes too much of a fuss in your stomach. As you slurp down her waist, you feel her tail pressing against your tongue. Swallowing again, you tilt your head back, allowing the cat girl's slender legs to slide down your throat. With a final *gulp*, you finish sending the cat girl to your stomach.

With your meal now fully inside you, you flop to your side, your large, stretched stomach lying against the cold stone floor of the cave. You slowly stroke your stomach, feeling your enhanced digestive acids begin to work on breaking down your large meal. You feel your stomach's occupant struggling wildly, although after only a few minutes their struggles die down to almost nothing. With your stomach now more manageable, you stand up and turn your attention over to the kittens.
1121.title: It works! The spell holds up just long enough.

1122.content:
Feeling the spell already weakening the moment you jump her you curse the goddess of gluttony for refusing to let you ever gain a pound to pack power into your spells with. There’s absolutely no way you’ll crest the momma cat’s prey filled belly in time.

But her smaller kittens are asleep, defenseless and much slimmer. At least there you would have a chance to finish before the momma cat eats you, and with even a mere kitten in your belly you could flash digest her for enough power to deep fry the whole family, or cast a powerful sleep spell.
1122.title: A Quick Plan B

11221.content:
In your later years it never would cease to amaze you just how much difference in perspective your life being on the line could make. Just moments ago the thought of eating the kittens would have made you feel horrible, but with the absolute impossibility of swallowing the large mother cat girl staring you in the face it became absolutely fine. A stroke of brilliance even!

In the moment it was as if time had frozen, your mind contemplating three options at lightening speed. The first was to swallow the mother cat while the spell was weakening. But standing a full head taller than yourself with breasts the size of cantaloupes from her villager meals and an ass that was closer to the size of watermelons it would take you at least a couple minutes to swallow her down. And the prey filled gut put the final nail in the coffin for that idea.

Running away occurred to you as well, but your own bookish habits and the enforced laziness that Madame Lustria always insisted would help you gain the weight and magical power had destroyed your physical stamina. Not to mention the toned legs and defined arms of the mother cat girl which gave testimony to the physical pred’s strength and speed. You’d never make it.

Your magic was already used up completely, the one spell enough to push the limits of your puny mana. But the kittens were merely ten or fifteen feet away. The largest of the kittens was maybe as tall as the mosquito bites you pretended were breasts and due to youth was no more shapely a woman than you.

Of course, you took no chances, going for the runt of the pack who was even smaller than that. You never could remember being in the middle space. You recall being on the far side of the mother cat, consciously deciding to eat one of the kittens, and suddenly you had the smallest one’s legs in your stomach and belly in your mouth, gulping as fast as possible as the mother cat shook off the paralysis spell.

The mother cat tried to run at you, but tripped as the lingering after effects of the paralysis spell were still destroying her coordination. It wouldn’t have stopped her from kicking your ass or running you down, but it bought you another dozen seconds.

And that was all you needed to finish your meal. You whispered the bedrock spell of all Gastromancers, the spell that turned the stomach into a terrifying destroyer of prey that flooded the Gastromancer with powerful, rich mana. “Velox Digestum.”

As the mother cat ran at you again your belly rounded in seconds and mana flowed through you. Acting by instinct instead of plan you cast a levitation spell on the leaping feline predator, perfectly arresting her momentum.
11221.title: Kitten Gets Eaten

112212.content:
The mother cat screamed. “How could you!? Monster!” She was almost insane with grief and fury, able to watch your belly visibly shrink as you continued digesting your first prey. Her claws wildly, and fruitlessly, swung through the air as the levitation spell denied her any purchase.

You knew that you had to act quickly as the mana you had right now was temporary following the use of Velox Digestum. It was the best spell for regaining mana quickly, but it had three major drawbacks compared to letting nature take its course or using one of the other digestive spells. Right now the concerning part for you was that as soon as your stomach was flat your mana would revert to zero within about 3 seconds.

Seeing the remaining 3 kittens stirring from their mother’s screaming yowls, you cast your strongest ice spell on the mother cat to silence her. It works, suspending her in a block of frosted ice a couple inches thick. But even though you currently have near endless mana, you are still a young and inexperienced mage. Maintaining a spell while casting another requires a fine tuned multitasking concentration that still eludes you. As a result, the levitation spell ends even as the ice spell freezes her and the mother cat crashes into the ground with an ear splitting crash.

The kittens all snap awake and notice their mother’s blue skin and shivering form. They also see your still shrinking stomach and realize one of their sisters is missing. The kittens may be young, but they still had sharp fangs and deadly claws that you can see them preparing.

Furious at yourself, you present them with a savage scrawl. For the moment the mother cat is still incapacitated from the combination of the three spells inflicted on her, but you can’t eat her while the kittens claw at you! Even worse there’s not enough of their sister in your gut to reliably subvert their minds back to sleep, not with your ham fisted skills.

While you consider your short list of bad options, the largest of the kittens jumps at you and claws your arm. You manage a barrier spell, but can feel your mana dip even lower. You cannot afford to defend or to wait. You need to attack and win quickly while you still can!
112212.title: Frozen Crash

1122121.content:
Your stomach had flattened by now, and your mana was basically at your usual maximum. Of course Velox Digestum was still running, but that was because it only shut off when there was no food and no mana left. This had to end both fast and efficient, which meant wasteful spells like fireball were out.

You threw yourself to the ground to dodge the kitten’s second clumsy attack and had an idea as you saw their foot paws on the rough, uneven cave floor. With a word of magic you made cracks open and shut in the rocks that the kittens stood on, trapping one of each of their foot paws in 6 inches of deep earth.

It had been intended to trap them, but your closest assailant lost her balance. A wide grin covers your face as the kitten falls into your mouth while the Velox Digestum still ran. You swallowed hurriedly, feeling the momentum of the confrontation finally swinging your way as you finish devouring her.

With powerful mana flooding through you again you blast the remaining three cat girls with your magic, using raw force to deal damage that incapacitated them. You smiled with grim victory, as the battle had been much too close and had taken far too long. The question was what to do with them now that they were all knocked out, utterly incapable of resisting you.

The village’s request only wanted the threat removed, and using certain slave magic you could reduce the cat girls to reasonably docile pets. But that would take days of work and they would always remember the hateful girl who ate half the family and enslaved the others... At least you wouldn’t have killing what amounted to prisoners on your conscience.

A more obvious solution would be to just eat them all. The threat would be permanently gone, it wouldn’t take too long and would even advance your Gastromancy! After all, your bottleneck is your twig like frame. Due to Velox Digestum’s second major drawback you wouldn’t gain an ounce from the two kittens you’d already digested... but if you let nature take its course the rest of the family could help you thicken substantially. Surely it wouldn’t make you a monster to make what clearly was the rational choice?
1122121.title: Victory!

11221212.content:
You took the opportunity to think about it as the unstoppable spell reduced a second young cat girl to nothing inside your belly. You reflected on the madness in the mother’s eyes when you had no choice but to eat the first kitten. As well as the fury, uncoordinated as is was, that had driven the sisters to act to defend their mother. That much raw emotion... is frightening.

Especially since Gastromancy is far from the only sort of magic in the world. One branch, you recall Madame Lustria warning, was based in emotional energy rather than physical or spiritual. In her own equally endearing and annoying way, Madame Lustria had warned you of the immense danger that such magic posed to their own users.

She also touched on how strong such magic could be, especially in pursuit of revenge. Not exactly the warning you expected, but you learned more from Madame Lustria’s tangents than her main points.

Now, obviously without training it wouldn’t come to that. But most people who would buy such an exotic slave as a cat girl were the rich and powerful. Nobles and mages. All it would take was for one of the kittens to be bought by a mage and listen as they work and too much could be learned.

It was a stretch, but you’d seen among the bickering nobles that visited the shop exactly how long grudges could hold. And recalled two nobles, one who was kind and fair to all while the other was utterly ruthless to his enemies and tolerable to his allies.

The kind and fair noble had more friends, but even then his enemies were innumerable. Yet the ruthless man had no rivals... only a graveyard and those allies who were trustworthy.

You sigh, patting your empty belly as the spell comes to an end. You had reached your decision, and would nip this whole thing in the bud. The whole family was gathered together here, so if you finished the feast there was nothing to fear.

You pick up the mother by her head and start to swallow. You take your time to make it by her cantaloupe sized breasts, which leaked the most delicious milk, and crest her massive belly that was still working on some poor villager’s remains. Steadily you pull her in until with a final swallow the mother neko’s body slid into your belly.

With your stomach jutting a solid 3 foot out from your mosquito size chest, and a bit wider than your shoulders to boot, you have a bit of difficulty standing. Fortunately, you don’t have to and you sit between the last two young nekos.

You pull them both towards your mouth, and in the interest of speed you try to swallow them at the same time. It proves more challenging than the mother’s prey belly, but not much and you manage with a good deal of struggle.

You can feel them separating as they reach your stomach, the unconscious kittens going to either side of their mother and stretching your now painfully full stomach to a new record... at least when you don’t count using magic designed to strengthen the stomach in some fashion.

Your belly still extending out about 3 foot and mere inches, it now sprawls to the sides considerably and it was without doubt that your belly was bigger than you were. Clearly digesting such a feast would take a while, though you could speed it up or make the cave secure with magic. After all, you had ample mana with the feline family feast consumed. Doing so would reduce the benefits you gain in the long run though.
11221212.title: The Spoils

choices: There’s Got to be a More Effective Spell
112212121.content:
It was a really tough decision to make. The Gastromancer’s single biggest challenge was always having enough energy reserves, a challenge that the goddess of gluttony had decided to make even more brutal for you, and casting magic now would directly reduce the semi-permanent addition of pounds of high energy fat.

But if you didn’t do anything to secure the area you ran the risk of something wandering into the cave during the half a week you could see this taking. Even if it only took a day that risk was unacceptable.

Still there were two ways to go about this. You could focus on defense and gaining the most possible by using magic wards and experimenting, or make use of one of the other 2 tried and tested Gastromancer bedrock spells to absorb your prey in a swift, moderately efficient manner. Gaining a third the energy, or fat in this case, to digest in a tenth the time.
112212121.title: Use Magic

1122121211.content:
As trustworthy as Nunc Sorbere is, you just can’t force yourself to accept the idea of losing 2/3rds of your hard won spoils. Yet somehow you expected to find that maintaining good protective wards would take more than that in the long run.

Which meant you had to carefully consider how to craft a better spell. Before you got to thinking about it deeply you put up a trio of wards on the cave entrance. One to sound an alarm, one to activate a stony net and one to paralyze and shock the intruder. They were spaced out to give as much time as possible for you to react. As your recent experience had taught you, in a fight seconds was as precious as gold.

With the wards set, you turned your thoughts to making the most effective and efficient spell to aid digestion you could manage. You suppressed a wince as one of you prey woke and started moving inside you, the pain distracting your thoughts as they had been a few times already.

You started your considerations by looking at each of the three great pillars or bedrocks of a Gastromancer. Velox Digestum, the instant digestion spell was focused on turning pry into usable mana as fast as possible. It worked by enhancing the acid in the stomach and raising the temperature to match an oven, cooking any prey into slop at a visible speed. But until the processes of the body quit secreting acids it demanded an insane amount of mana every second. Ultimately 90% of the prey’s mana went to maintaining the spell and the rest would almost always be eaten through before the stomach realized it could stop with the acids. It also ran the risk of burning a literal hole in the stomach of the unwary Gastromancer since the destruction it caused exceeded the rate at which the stomach could repair itself.

That thought causes you to wince in pain again as the contents of your stomach shift. You lightly growl, rubbing your overstretched middle.

Nunc Sorbere was built for a different purpose, that being to allow the Gastromancer to quickly regain strength in the presence of an abundance of resources. Such as on a battlefield where each day the magic they wield horrifies their enemies and each night dozens of prisoners are fed to the Gastromancer. It focused on improving the elasticity and contraction strength of the stomach, and forcefully ground prey into pieces that the regular strength acids could more easily handle. It could be canceled at will, but was too slow for use in the middle of a fight.

A large movement from what had to be the mother cat makes you hiss with a stab of pain. Increased elasticity would be nice about now, but you’d already decided against using Nunc Sorbere. Still, if the pain got much worse you’d be willing to do quite a lot to get rid of the pain!

Devoratur Plenum actually slowed digestion considerably. The full absorption spell sacrificed everything on the altar of maximum gains. Time, constant effort involved, magic for defending yourself... even several regular body functions being potentially messed up if you abruptly ended the spell! Devoratur Plenum worked by giving the Gastromancer conscious control over every single subconscious body function from stomach contractions to heartbeat to a woman’s period. Then the Gastromancer would reorder the priority temporarily and slow the function of things to a crawl while stripping and absorbing every last scrap of whatever meal they consumed. Given that it doubled results, it was considered the best spell for maximizing gains, but you were in no position at all to use such a dangerous spell.

This time all three of your meals moved at the same time in a bid to escape while they could. The sudden agony was excruciating and made you think you’d been run through with a sword! But it lasted mere seconds before the kittens lost their strength.

Still, the comparison made you think. The Stoneskin spell was among your favorites for defense. You lacked the strength to maintain it for a full battle, but even in brief moments you can see how it would have served you better than your actual actions had.

Stoneskin didn’t replace your skin or body with stone. Instead, it infused your skin with the properties of stone in addition to that of skin. With Stoneskin active you could have punched the mother Neko’s stomach with enough force to floor her, since your hand would have felt like it weighed 20~30 pounds and the rest of your arm over a hundred. And swords became a joke as even a blow that might chip real stone were absorbed by your skin flexing just a fraction of an inch.

Actually, you thought with your excitement growing, if you cast Stoneskin on your stomach it would be an excellent solution! The toughness of the stone would save all the energy wasted repairing the stomach from self inflicted damage and prey’s struggles. The weight and force of the contractions of your belly would magnify instantly and the pain would vanish as your prey perished!

Without hesitation you drafted and cast your newly made spell, Stone Stomach!
1122121211.title: Eureka

11221212111.content:
Results showed in moments as the bellyache that you’d been feeling instantly stopped. But far more surprising was watching your stomach shrink nearly half a foot in all directions as the crunching sound of your prey’s bodies being smashed into each other so tightly that the died instantly.

You tried not to think about how mangled they probably already looked as you looked in awe at your much more compact and busily rumbling stomach. “Fae,” you ask yourself aloud, “what just happened?”

Mentally you review the effects of the Stone Stomach spell you had crafted. It allowed your stomach to secret it’s normal acids, to bulge and flex when pressured and enhanced the force exerted when the stomach squeezed its contents. Odd, none of that should...

Your eyes open with sudden, shocked understanding. While active your stomach was as resilient as stone, which meant that it took pressure an order of magnitude, if not 2 or 3 orders of magnitude, higher to make your stomach need to flex and stretch. So the moment the spell activated, your stomach followed the laws of physics and crushed everything in it until the pressure reached equilibrium again.

Excitedly you realize that this means that the spell can be even more effective than you thought! Canceling the spell your stomach billows back out to the former size, and you grimace as you feel several sharp points against the skin of your stomach. Then, as your stomach reaches full size you reactivate your Stone Stomach spell and again hear several crunching and snapping sounds as you effortlessly turn the neko bodies into a slurry of pulverized meat.

A grin spreads across your face as you realize just how efficient and effective the spell is. A dozen brief activations took you only a minute or so, costing less than leaving the spell active the entire time would have and progressing your digestion at a rate that would make Madame Lustria speechless. It wasn’t as fast as Velox Digestum, but it already far exceeded the speed of Nunc Sorbere and gave better than 100% gains relative to nonmagical digestion like Devoratur Plenum!

You hadn’t dared hope that it would exceed that mark for absorption before attempting the spell, and you’d have to test it to verify... but the fact of the matter was that you were expending extremely little energy. The work was all being done by the pressure your prey exerted on your stomach walls, and the steep pressure required to force a Stone Stomach to stretch even slightly!

Of course, you thought as you calmed some minutes later, each of the three pillars still exceeded your invention in some manner. Velox Digestum was easily 10 times faster, probably closer to 100 times as fast. Nunc Sorbere allowed the Gastromancer to fit far more food into their stomachs while in use, while you suspected that Stone Stomach would inhibit a binge if not carefully applied. And Devoratur Plenum would still hold the crown for the best absorption spell.

But Stone Stomach deserved to line shoulders with the three, and that before you even began refining it. Better yet, it had the broadest application.

Feeling extraordinarily proud of yourself, you napped and fiddled with the spell for a period of time, and by sunset your stomach was completely empty. With a smile you turn your attention to the weight that finally stuck to your body, giving you a...
11221212111.title: The Stone Stomach Shock

112212121111.content:
You could barely believe the effects your meal had had on you! You estimated that you’d gained 15 pounds, and it made quite a difference.

Of course, how tiny you were to start out played a big part in that. If Madame Lustria gained 15 pounds only the most astute would really notice, but the towering woman was taller than most men and boasted large breasts, hips twice as wide as you are and a modest potbelly. If you were to guess you’d put Madame Lustria at over 250 pounds, being conservative. 300 pounds might have been more accurate.

On the other hand, you had been absolutely diminutive before your big feast. Barely 5 foot tall, your 3 measurements had been 27 inch bust, 20 inch waist and merely 30 inches at the hips. The only reason you’d even had a womanly shape at all was because your stomach was even smaller than the rest of you! All told you had been 75 pounds of skin, bone and vital organs.

So of course 15 pounds made a very visible difference on you. Sadly you were still a thin tiny thing, but you had grown. Now you stood 5’2 and while you hadn’t brought a tape measure with you it seemed that all 3 of your womanly measurements had increased by 2 inches.

Where before you had looked painfully scrawny and anorexic, with your ribs easy to count, now you were an attractive sort of slender. Your breasts were small, but defined and perky, while your hips flared out just a bit and your butt would tempt boys everywhere if you wore a daring sort of skirt.

The thought makes you blush and turn your attention back to the present. After all, those were uncomfortable thoughts for a virgin maiden like you... only even entering your head because of Madame Lustria’s influence. A quick spell fixes your tight clothes, making them loose again, and you easily gather your belongings up again while deactivating the wards you’d placed.

With the threat removed it was time to go get paid by the village!
112212121111.title: Humble Beginnings

choices: Prove Your Magic With A Spell
1122121211112.content:
The return trip was swift and easy for you, as the cave had been merely an hour’s walk from the village and even after sunset you could light your path with magic. And so you arrived at the loose arrangement of a couple dozen houses and a tavern while most of the villagers would still be drinking together in the tavern.

You hesitated to go into the establishment, as this tiny and out of the way village was a good half day’s journey from the much larger town of Norlec. Though with a population of only a thousand, Norlec itself might be better called a village. Still, in Norlec almost everyone recognizes you as Lustria’s apprentice and that won you respect and fear in equal measure from the peasants.

But out here in the middle of nowhere that protection and comfort wouldn’t exist. You braced yourself mentally for the way you’d seen the drunk men at Norlec’s tavern treat normal girls. You didn’t have much choice to avoid going in. Ultimately the Mayor owned the place and it was the only location where you could rent a room for the night.

With a deep breath you pushed open the door and walked in. Immediately almost a dozen and a half men, the majority of the patrons, turned to the door and looked at you with the sheer distrust and disdain peasants always gave an outsider. You did your best to ignore the looks and headed to the bar.

The man who was running the bar was broad but short, and had a beard that was went down a third of his torso. You immediately were reminded of drawings you had seen of the Dwarven race, but he didn’t quite fit that picture. Dwarves were shorter than even you by a decent half head or more, but he was 3 or 4 inches taller than you. Maybe a half? Might be best not to mention it at all.

Annoyed by your silence and staring he spoke first. “If you don’t want a drink or a room than get out before I toss you out stranger.” He gruffly rumbled.

You give a small start, realizing just how rude you’d been acting. “I’m sorry. I was looking for Mayor Gomream?” As you said the name you suddenly realized how Dwarven it sounded, which had initially escaped your attention.

The half-Dwarf snarls. “You’re looking at him lass. What business ya got with me when I don’t know you from a horse’s behind?”

You straighten up at his insulting manner, trying to hold down your own anger. “I am Madame Lustria’s apprentice and I am here to inform you that the cave is emptied of all dangerous inhabitants.”

Mayor Gomream guffaws at that. “The old bitch took in a runt like you? Do you take me for a fool? Even if you were a Gastromancer like her you’d be the weakest Gastromancer in history!” He calls to the whole room, explaining to the other peasants in a quick and effective way just how ridiculous the claim was. They all shared his merriment and heaped up even more insults and rough comments on you.

You could feel your rage swiftly rising at the insolence show to your master and the laughter your honesty was met with. You had come to receive your proper payment and a room for the night, but if this was how they dared to treat you than maybe a demonstration was in order to cow these superstitious animals.
1122121211112.title: Injustice!

11221212111122.content:
You quickly scanned the room for the right target. Someone big enough to provide proof of concept and small enough to be quickly devoured. After all, even if you ate the biggest man in the room it wouldn’t accomplish as much if you took 5 minutes to struggle him down.

A petite serving girl passes by in front of you and without hesitation you decide to take the opportunity that her rounds had created... an opportunity to take your prey by complete surprise.

A spark of electricity from your fingers was all it took to wreck havoc with her coordination and her head entered your open maw in the same moment. By the time her tray full of mugs hit the ground you were at her hips and the room was going cold with shocked fear.

Eating as efficiently as possible you finish swallowing her down before anyone can recover from their shock. You burp softly, covering your mouth with your hand. “I’m sorry, what were you saying about Madame Lustria? And about my qualifications to be her apprentice? Here, let me show you a predator’s spell.”

Moments later the peasants in the room backed away with terror as the sound of rock shattering bone echoed in the tavern and your stomach shrank visibly. When Stone Stomach had regularized the internal pressure it reached the point of silence where a pin drop would seem loud. You smiled at the villagers in turn.

“Now, as I was saying. The threat that used to live in that cave is no more. Which leaves the matter of payment.” You smile at the half-dwarf Mayor.

This causes Mayor Gomream to grumble under his breath as he went to open up the chest that contained the village’s treasury. He took a small coin purse and put a handful of coins in it before handing it to you.

The moment you grabbed the purse you knew it was too light. You growled and took a closer look.
11221212111122.title: Getting Paid

112212121111222.content:
(Breaking character to explain money faster and easier. 1 Gold = 100 Silver = 10,000 Copper. 1 Silver = $13~17 depending on who minted it and the fluctuation carries over to Gold and Copper. So to a villager even a single Gold piece is a treasure able to buy a cow or a wagon, Silvers are the staple coin used to buy a good meal or a couple for a tool, and Coppers are spare change to make the values actually come out properly.)

When you saw the two dozen coppers sitting in the coin purse you looked back up at Mayor Gomream with unconcealed fury. “What is this?” You demand. It might be a decent tip for a waitress, but the amount in the coin purse wouldn’t even buy more than a mug of whatever alcohol he served... not even a meal to go with the drink! Maybe a loaf of bread on the market place.

Mayor Gomream grins. “That’s the reward money minus a few fees.” He seemed inordinately proud of himself.

You didn’t share the feeling. “What fees?” You seethed. The reward for risking your life should have been at least 3 or 4 Gold with some Silvers, and he wanted to play games while giving you a pittance!?

“Finder’s fee for Jerom, message delivery for George, taxes for the Governor, Lord and King, Master’s fee for Madame Lustria, a collection fee for myself acting on the part of the village and the cost of buying my waitress as a slave so you could eat her.” Mayor Gomream rattled off quickly and naturally. “Oh, don’t forget the church’s fees for overlooking the use of evil magics. That’s a steep one.”

Feeling nearly floored by the long list you blinked as you tried to find a hole in it to take advantage of. You knew the church, taxes and Madame Lustria’s Master’s fee should add up to basically 2/3rds of the reward. Which put you down to 1 Gold and a handful of Silvers... not the worst price for a slave girl though probably the most expensive meal you’d ever eaten.

“Before fees what was the agreement you made with my Master? There should be a copy in writing sent back here with the messenger.” You asked, hoping that Madame Lustria had included the normal clause about increased pay with increased number of removed threats.

Mayor Gomream’s face twitched. “I’ll go dig it up. Have a seat and some patience.”

You smiled. Now he would have to treat you fairly. There was no way for him to get around it in the end you were certain.

About a minute later he slapped the scroll down in front of you and you eagerly started reading. The legalistic language was as slippery as always, but the essence of the matter was straightforward.

In the event the cave had been harmless to start with the Village would have owed 2 Gold for coming out to check on things. In the event that there were dangers lurking around the cave the price would go up immediately but would depend on what form the dangers took.

Bandits would run 5 Silver a head while curses would charge over 10 Gold to break since most were nasty. A brief look finds you the price tag for anthropomorphic beasts, such as werewolves, centaurs and nekos. 75 Silver each.

“The cave had been home to a family of predatory anthros. Nekos to be exact. There were 5, now there are none.” You explain happily. That gave you 5 Gold before fees and clearly meant that the stingy Mayor Gomream had to increase what he paid you dramatically.

“Got any proof?” He asked.

You go to retort, the swallow your words as you realize that you don’t.

Your face is clearly all the answer he needs. “Looks like I over paid you according to the agreement than as you cannot prove that the cave wasn’t dangerous before you camped in it. I guess that means I need this back.” He smugly takes the meager coin purse and writes a few figures on the back of the scroll before looking up. “And you still owe me 37 Silver and 79 Copper for the purchase and consumption of my waitress.”
112212121111222.title: Getting Cheated

1122121211112222.content:
You didn’t think. At that point you really couldn’t anymore. Instead, you just swallowed. Unsure when exactly you grabbed the Mayor and magically bound him, you hurriedly gobbled him up.

If the room had gone still when you ate the waitress, now it dissolved into utter pandemonium. Several of the peasants went to try to stop you from finishing the Mayor while others hid and you noticed a couple heading for the door.

You panicked, fighting to swallow Mayor Gomream as two men pulled on his legs. You couldn’t let them retrieve him now or you would face horrible consequences!

Forcing yourself to focus you blast one of the two with the paralysis spell that had failed on the Neko mother. Either because his resistance to magic was far weaker or your magic had grown even stronger than you’d hoped he locks up completely. The other one you confuse, adding to the chaos with a light and sound show that ruined the entire room’s ability to maintain their balance.

It gave you the time to finish gulping down the Mayor. As you did so you realized that your actions would have terrible consequences, with both the King and the church expressly forbidding any predator capable individual from eating government officials for obvious reasons. The taboo was so massive that it wouldn’t end at your head... Madame Lustria would hang for this with you!

All is not lost though. You realize that your problem can be solved with surprisingly simple methods... which all required the same next step. Eliminate all witnesses! Recalling the villagers who had headed for the door you swiftly double check if they made it as the others regained their feet.
1122121211112222.title: Getting Even

11221212111122221.content:
Thankfully the two who’d gone to the door never made it there. Instead they had fallen victim to your disabling lights and sounds. You had precious little time though, as they were already standing back up. “Velox Digestum.” You said without hesitation.

After all, there were 23 patrons, 2 remaining waitresses, at least one cook and possible tenets in the upstairs rooms. And all of them had to disappear along with Mayor Gomream to prevent the worst possible outcome. It would be one hell of a task, and you needed every last scrap of magic possible.

The first thing you did was ward the building to look and sound normal. It took moments that you nearly didn’t have, but a suction spell in the next second stopped the men at the door before they escaped.

One of the waitresses, a brave and voluptuous thing, rushes at you with a kitchen knife. A bolt of lightning as thick as your wrist fried her and arced through several others in the room. Peasants, it became clear, couldn’t stand up to your magic the way the catgirls had. Especially not to match the mother.

Some 5 or 6 of them were knocked out already. The others were fighting the suction spell or trying to leave through the back. You cast a firewall spell around the entirety of the tavern, just inside of the illusion. If someone got too close to the building they’d feel the heat, but it couldn’t be helped. If even one of the people in the tavern escaped you’d have to eat the entire village to control the story.

You swiftly ate the brave waitress while the villagers, now realizing they were trapped, attempted to hide. Once your stomach was filled again, continuing to maintain your mana levels, you conjured digestible ropes to bind the unconscious villagers and started to hunt out those hiding.

It wasn’t really that hard. A locked door would break open to a single force-wave spell, and the peasants were now so scared that most of them barely resisted when you restrained them with easy to digest rope and tossed them into the growing pile of the floor. As for the brave souls who resisted... a more potent spell and a gulp took care of them and of your mana levels. Soon all of the tavern goers, residents and workers had either been digested or were huddled up in your pile in the middle of the main room. Restrained for a most delicious and delightful feast.

Now you just needed to think of a good excuse for the destruction of the entire inn and death of all the people inside it. Once that was resolved you could eat the 17 remaining villagers in a more relaxed way that would let you keep the pounds that Velox Digestum had destroyed of your other victims and cast an illusion of that attack to fool the rest of the village into thinking you were their savior who had eaten the destroyer.
11221212111122221.title: No Witnesses

114.content:
...spiders. Large cobwebs hung between the surrounding trees, only growing thicker and more common the close they got to the mouth of the cave.

"Yep, definitely spiders," you say to no one in particular, "this should be easy." You extend your right hand, pointing you empty palm towards the depths of the cave. You concentrate on your body heat and mutter the incantation to cast a fireball. Your palm begins to glow and heat up until...

*Poof*

The gathered energy instantly dissipates into a small cloud of black smoke that drifts away in the wind.

"What the?" you say. "That should have worked. Unless..." Suddenly, your stomach lets out a loud, empty, gurgle. "Ugh, crap, I forgot breakfast."

"That's the problem with gastromancy," you think to yourself, "It never works on an empty stomach. Bleck, better go find one of these spiders, I'm never gonna be able to cast anything like this."

Gripping the handle of your dagger, you start walking into the cave. You walk carefully, making sure not to get caught in any of the webs. Even as carefully as you move, it gets increasing difficult as the cave gets darker and darker the deeper you go. Despite your best efforts, you trip on a bump in the terrain.
114.title: Not enough juice.

1141.content: Sticking your arms out to the sides and flailing them rapidly, you manage to regain your balance. You continue through the cave, now more careful than before. You now find yourself deep deep inside the cave, the entrance now being a small ball in the distance. Turning your attention back towards the cave, you see a couple of spiders guarding the outside of the main nest. A shiver runs down your spine as you consider the prospect of eating one, even if it is just to fuel your powers. As a last ditch effort, you look around, hoping for something else. Just as you begin to lose hope, you spot a vaguely humanoid shape wrapped up in the web, probably one of the lost villagers. You could probably eat that, but it still felt a bit... wrong.
1141.title: Finding fuel.

11412.content:
As wrong as it feels to eat an innocent person, no matter how dead they are, it definitely beats eating one of the spiders. You quickly sneak over to the cocoon and begin cutting it down. Lowering it down gently, you find that it's a lot less sticky compared to the normal webbing. You let out a sigh of relief that you're not going to have to cut it open before positioning yourself at one end. You open your mouth much wider than a normal person can, a side effect of your gastromancy, before lifting the cocoon into your mouth. The silk leaves a bland taste on your tongue, so you quickly swallow, sending it into your awaiting throat. You gulp as quickly as you can while remaining quiet so as not to alert the spiders to your presence. It isn't long before the cocoon is fully inside your stomach, which is now lightly gurgling as it digests it's meal. You test out your magic by casting a night vision spell on yourself and find it working as intended as the cave lights up around you. You stand up, cradling your bloated stomach and begin making your way back out, now much easier because you can so.

Once out of the cave you repeat the same process as before, extending your palm and casting the spell. A bright red fireball releases from your hand, shooting straight into the cave. Light floods the cave as the fireball flies through it, lighting any webs it passes on fire. Once it strikes the back of the cave it erupts in a beautiful explosion of red and orange, lighting the nest ablaze. You continue pointing your arm at the cave, shooting and fleeing spiders with more fireballs. You stand guard, waiting until the fire finally burns out. You keep your guard up as you return to the cave, making sure that the cave is totally clear, before returning to Madame Lustria's shop. You take notice at just how much magical energy it took, with your once extremely bloated stomach now the size of a large pot belly.

You quickly return to Norlec, very pleased with yourself and how you handled your first quest. You walk through the shop door and shout, "Madame! I'm back!"

The thick figure of Madame Lustria quickly appears from the back of the shop.

"Oh, you're back!" She says gladly, leaning on the counter and inadvertently, you hope, giving you a straight view down her deep cleavage. "Soooo, how did it go?"

"It went well," you explain, "just a cave of giant spiders. They're nothing but ash now."

"Aww, look at my big bad gastromancy!" She says, lovingly pinching your cheek.

"Madame, please," you plead.

"Oh, but you're just so cute! Now, I've gotten a couple orders while you were gone, if you can work on those while I inform the mayor, that would be wonderful!"

You let out a deep sigh before saying, "Yes, Madame." as she walks out of the shop, giving you a kind wave.

You take a look at the list Madame Lustria left on the workstation in the backroom. On it are two potions, a shrinking potion, and growing potion. Both are rather laborious potions that would take about a day each to brew. You decide to work on...
11412.title: Villager power.

114121.content: You figure that you might as start with the top of the list, so you start a fire under the cauldron and begin working on a base. You slave away in the increasingly hot room, only getting a break when checking on the front counter. You repeat this process: work, check, work check, until...
114121.title: Back to work.

choices: ... another spellcaster! They must have set up shop here.
... a dragon! That doesn't sound good...
... a curse! A pretty nasty one too.
115.content:
The first indication that something about the cave was odd was when you began smelling the color purple. Not long after that, you began hearing the taste of tree bark and tasting the touch of the grass beneath your feet. Such sensations usually disoriented people, considering that they were impossible. Of course, since magic makes the impossible possible, these were tell-tale signs that an ambient magic aura was suffusing this place.

Of course, after realizing that there was magic in the area, you immediately began the steps to identifying it. One of Madame Lustria's first lessons had been on how to identify different kinds of magic. After all, one dealt with fireballs and curses in entirely different ways. You pull a strip of griffon jerky out of your pack, and chew it thoughtfully as you think over the identification spell that you need to use. When the magic-infused food is all in your belly, you perform the incantation and make the proper gestures.

After a few moments, you realize that the spell is a success! The source of the extra magic in the area is...
115.title: Magic

choices: She is a very curvy cow.
He is a very muscular demon.
It is a collection of random parts animated by magic.
1151.content:
The identification spell goes to work and you soon know that there’s another spell caster at fault in the cave. The whole area is awash in spells to help prevent anyone from wandering in. Now that you’re looking for it, you can also see traces of a spell that would take control of people and draw them in. You can tell how reduced that particular imprint is and know that it's not active now though.

Squaring your scrawny shoulders, you use the last of the reserves granted by the jerky to ward yourself against the worst of the repulsion magics. As you do so, the disorienting effects fade enough that you can focus again.

You proceed into the cave with quite a bit more care now. It would have been one thing to deal with a wild animal or even a curse of some sort, but tangling with another spell caster poses some extra danger. You make sure to mask your own magical signature, not wanting to alert whoever may lie ahead.

The rough soil and stone walls meanders down and down beneath the ground. Soon the darkness eats the light that leaked in from outside. You frown as you finger the last strip of griffin jerky in your pouch. You really should have been better prepared for such a trip, but Madame Lustria shoved you out the door before you could have stocked up. Not wanting to turn back and risk her thinking you incapable, you pull the strip out and soon gulp it down. Then you cast a simple dark sight charm. Once you are able to see again, you continue onwards.

It feels like you’ve been wandering through the darkness for hours when you turn another corner and see a faint flickering light coming from ahead. As you creep closer, you hear a woman sobbing. Then a voice cuts through the cool air.

“Shush, my dear. You’ve done very well so far, and we are close to being finished.”

You feel a shiver pass down your spine at hearing that voice, though you are not sure why. Despite that, you press on, coming to the last corner and peeking around the edge. Beyond lays a huge chamber carved out of the ground. Candles float throughout the room emitting the flickering light. The glow illuminates a collection of tables covered with many books, as well as magical and alchemical tools. Haphazard piles of more books and items overflow the bookcases standing against the walls of the chamber.

You pay very little attention to all that though. Your gaze focuses much more on who has to be the spell caster that has been causing so much trouble.
1151.title: Delving deep

choices: Try and interrupt whatever ritual is happening.
Drag the woman away and ask her what's happening.
11512.content:
Standing near the center of the cave, you see a tall, muscular being with red skin and occasional patches of dark red fur covering its head, chest, and waist. Following its body down past its cloven hooves, you see a summoning circle carved into the floor. You silently jump as you hear the demon speak again.

"I just have one last request for you, activate the circle."

Turning your attention back to the demon, you see him stroking the cheek of a young, beautiful woman hanging from the ceiling by a rope tied to her wrists. You watch in horrified silence as the woman clasps her hands together and begins chanting an old, demonic chant. As the woman speaks the arcane words, the circle beneath the demon begins to glow a deep, crimson red light.

"And now," The demon says, roughly grabbing the woman by her face, "I no longer need you."

With a quick flick of his wrist, the demon tore the woman away from her bindings, tossing her towards the exit of the cave. She lands on the ground not to far away from you. Looking back and forth between the woman and the demon, you wonder what you should do.
11512.title: He is a very muscular demon.

115121.content: Your mind races as you watch the demon silently revel in his victory. You're not sure what the ritual will accomplish, but you know it can't be good. You think back to all Madame Lustria taught you about magic rituals, and remember that the easiest way to stop one would be to break the circle. Normally, this would be easy as the circle would be made of something like salt or ash, but this circle was carved into the stone floor, making it a lot harder to disrupt. Normally, a simple earth molding spell would be enough for this, but your magic reserves were already extremely low, and you'd completely run out of food. Even if you did have enough mana to cast the spell, you're not sure how you'd deal with the demon. Looking around the room for something, anything that might help you, you notice the table covered with alchemist's supplies. It was covered with mixing bowls, vials of ingredients, and other equipment, but what intrigued you the most were what seemed to be some completed potions. It was impossible to tell from this distance what the potions were, but they truly seemed to be your only option, so you steady yourself and begin to sneak over to the table.
115121.title: Try and interrupt whatever ritual is happening.

1151211.content:
You hold your breath as you start to slowly crawl over to the table. You're careful with your footing, making sure not to kick aside even the smallest of pebbles and alerting the demon. It isn't long before you make it to the table, but it seems that luck wasn't on your side, as the demon takes a quick scan around the room. You try to hide from its gaze, but with nothing to hide behind, you're hopelessly stuck in its sight.

"Well, well, well, what's a little girl like you doing in here?" The demon says, slowly stomping towards your position.

"I... I was j...just exploring," you manage to stammer out, "and then I stumbled upon this cave and..."

"That doesn't really matter. Now that you're in here," The demon tosses the table to the side, shattering the last of your hopes as now nothing is stopping the demon from getting to you, "You're not getting out."

The demon quickly grabs you around the waist, hoisting you up to his eye level.

"It's really a shame you had to stumble in here," the demon says, "I do think you look rather cute. I wish I could keep you, but I'm afraid my companions would ruin that for me."

You give a horrified expression as a smile slowly spreads across the demon's face.

info.brief_description: You are a Gastromancer, a wizard that gains power by devouring other people and creatures!
info.description:
Welcome to my first interactive!

In this story, you take the place of Fae, an apprentice Gastromancer. As the name implies, a gastromancer is a witch or wizard who gains their powers by devouring other living creatures. Do you have what it takes to become the next great magician? Or will you become just another layer of fat on some other being?

Rules
1. Any kind of vore is allowed, go wild. I will not put limits on it. This includes oral, giantess, shrinking, breast, anal, unbirth, etc. Hard vore is acceptable as well, but put always put a choice to opt out of it first as many people seem to dislike it.
2. Scat is allowed but again, like the above, put a choice to opt out of it so that those who dislike it do not have to read it to continue the story.

3. Try and use proper grammar and spelling. I understand English is not everyone's first language, but try your best. If you leave it legible I'll even correct errors for you in case you miss them.
4. Chapters must be at least a paragraph long. I'm not asking you to write a book for each entry, but some length would be nice.
5. No derailing! Though I allow everything, try and stick with the flow of previously established chapters. Don't, for instance, choose an option that ends in oral vore and suddenly switch it to another kind without reason.
6. Finally, sexual content is allowed and encouraged. Gay and lesbians are fine as well, though again, please don't take a line of heterosexual chapters and suddenly switch them to homosexuality. Put in some good build-up first.

Gift points for those who add as well.
